detail.content: New York University Courant Institute of Mathematics                                                                                                                         SEARCH                                                                                                                                    Mathematics in Finance on Twitter                                 Subscribe to MathFinanceNYU                          Notice to Fall 2015 applicants: The         department has started to review applications.         Please note that this process can take several         weeks. We cannot guarantee a decision date;         you will be contacted by the Graduate School         when an admission decision has been made on         your application. If you have any questions         and concerns regarding your application,         please contact the Math Department at mathfinapp@cims.nyu.edu .                                       Current News         Upcoming Information Sessions :         Monday, May 11th at 7:10pm, Room 517                                                                                               For details and other news, click here . Berkley Scholarship Program   Loan Programs   Teaching & Graduate Fellowships   Resources for Military Veterans   Resources for Social Enterprise   Tuition & Cost of Attendance     Admissions Request Information   Apply   Selection Criteria   Deadlines   Notification & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   Directors' Tips   FAQs     Meet With Us Visit Stern   Travel Directions   Events and Webinars   Videos   Day in the Life Student Videos   Podcasts   Virtual Tour   Contact a Student               Home / Programs & Admissions / Full-time MBA / Academics / Specializations / Finance                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Finance   A specialization in Finance offers insight into how financial markets function. One of the finest in the world, Stern's Finance department provides the necessary education for students seeking positions in industry, in financial institutions or in government or nonprofit institutions. Students work with field leaders and have the opportunity to participate in real-world learning programs like the Michael Price Student Investment Fund .   Sample Courses:                           Bankruptcy and Reorganization       Behavioral Finance       Debt Instruments and Markets       Equity Markets: Trading and Structure       Futures and Options                           Investment Banking       Real Estate Capital Markets       Private Equity Finance       Valuation       Volatility                        Please note that this is a selection of courses and is subject to change. For more information, visit the course index .             Especially Applicable to Careers in Finance and Real Estate such as:                           Asset Management       Corporate Finance       Equity and Fixed Income Research       International Sales/Emerging Markets                           Investment Banking       Private Client Services       Real Estate Finance       Sales and Trading                       Watch the videos below to learn more about Finance at Stern:   Alumni Journeys                      Juan Guzman, MBA 2007     Vice President, Advisory, Blackstone                  Simran Kaur, MBA 2009       Vice President, Investor Solutions, Barclays                 The Future of Business: Finance & Real Estate                            Professor Charles Murphy                Professor Stijn Van Nieuwerburgh                Professor Robert Whitelaw                 <--Back to Specializations                                                Take Action      Sign Up for Information    Meet With Us    Apply                                                Career Links      Resources in finance    Resources in real estate    Select employers of Stern graduates                     Academic Links      Course descriptions    MBA/MS in Mathematics in Finance    Salomon Research Institute in Financial Institutions and Markets    Glucksman Institute for Research in Securities Markets    Volatility Institute    Center for Real Estate Finance Research                     News   Stern Finance professors Thomas Philippon and Alexi Savov, in partnership with the Federal Reserve Bank of NY, find that technology has not made markets more efficient                 Engage with Finance at NYU Stern     EVALUATION is NYU Stern's Student-Run Investment Newsletter. Master's Programs   Short Courses     Student Jobs MBA   Undergraduate   PhD   Finance Student Spotlight     Research Centers Center for Real Estate Finance Research   Glucksman Institute for Research in Securities Markets     Other Resources                                     Stern Finance is widely recognized as one of the premier departments of finance in the world.                Finance Department           – Message from the Department Chair          With more than 40 full-time faculty conducting advanced research in every major aspect of the field, students have access to an unparalleled variety of courses reflecting the latest market practices and research findings.    I invite you to explore these pages to experience the range of research, courses, seminars, special events and other resources that contribute to the vibrant intellectual life of Stern’s Finance Department.    I also invite all visitors to examine our faculty’s latest publications. Guaranteed to Fail (2011) co-authored by Viral Acharya , Matthew Richardson , Stijn Van Nieuwerburgh and Lawrence White looks at Fannie Mae’s and Freddie Mac’s roles in the mortgage meltdown. Additionally, Restoring Financial Stability: Policy Recommendations from NYU Stern (2009), co-edited by Finance Professors Viral Acharya and Matthew Richardson, offers financial policy alternatives­ and specific courses of action ­to restore the global financial system. A companion volume, Regulating Wall Street (2010), co-edited by Professors Thomas Cooley, Viral Acharya , Matthew Richardson and Ingo Walter addresses the reform legislation debated by the U.S. Congress.          Robert Whitelaw , Chair  Edward C. Johnson 3d Professor of Entrepreneurial Finance                Most Visited       Working Papers    MBA Courses    Undergraduate Courses    PhD Students on the Job Market          Faculty Spotlight       After surveying alumni from the world's leading business schools, US News has rated Stern's Finance Ungraduate Program as #2 and the Graduate Program as #3 in the United States.      Contact us   Department of Finance  NYU Stern School of Business  Henry Kaufman Management Center  44 West 4th St.  New York, NY 10012          New & Notable Courses                  Matthew Richardson      Professor of Finance      FINC-GB.2350: Alternative Investments I      FINC-GB.2351: Alternative Investments II                   Stephen Figlewski and Bruce Tuckman      Professors of Finance      FINC-GB.2349: Trading Cash and Derivative Securities                   Richard Levich      Professor of Finance      FINC-GB.3320: Managing Investment Funds (Michael Price Student Investment Fund)                 Recent Publications     "VOLCKER: The Triumph of Persistence " by William L.
